p: Physalis peruviana L. is a plant of the family Solanaceae and the genus Physalis, which has about 100 species [ 21]. It is commonly referred to as the gooseberry [ 22]. Physalis peruviana is a medicinal plant widely used in traditional medicine to treat diseases such as malaria, asthma, hepatitis, dermatitis, cancer and rheumatism. It has antispasmodic, diuretic, antiseptic, sedative, analgesic, antioxidant, antifungal, antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, cataract-cleansing, antidiabetic and antiparasitic properties [ 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 28]. It has been described as a good source of nutrients and bioactive compounds, Î²-carotene and vitamins A and C, and minerals including K, Mg and Cu, with moderate fibre content, phenolic compounds and low levels of calories [ 29, 30].
